conclusion: Determine how the range of light incident changes after embedding the glass brick using Snell's Law and critical angle.
Determine the critical angle using Snell's Law: \( \theta_c = \arcsin \left( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{3} \right) \approx 35.26^\circ \).
Calculate the angle of incidence before embedding the glass brick: \( \theta_i = 30^\circ \).
Calculate the angle of incidence after embedding the glass brick: \( \theta_{new} = 35.26^\circ \).
Determine the increase in the range of light: \( \Delta \theta = 5.26^\circ \).
The range of light incident is increased by approximately \( 5.26^\circ \).
